In a nation where corporate media defines what's "acceptable," voter turnout lags behind almost every major nation and billionaires can buy elections, our job is to open the doors of democracy and elect candidates who support economic, social, racial and environmental justice.

This is what the political revolution is all about. All across this country working people and young people are getting involved in the political process, running grassroots campaigns, taking on the establishment and winning elections. https://www.nytimes.com/2018/06/30/opinion/democratic-socialists-progressive-democratic-party-trump.html

Cities and states across America are already working to stop our country from repeating the same mistakes of the past. We need to move a step further — it’s time to legalize marijuana at the federal level. http://thehill.com/opinion/judiciary/394915-public-support-for-medical-marijuana-access-is-overwhelming-and-bipartisan
